findings: Nodular opacities noted in the right lower lobe, suspicious for pneumonia.

notes.title: Patient Symptoms
notes.content: Patient presents with persistent cough and fever for 3 days.

notes.title: Medical History
notes.content: No significant past medical history of respiratory issues.

findings: Hairline fracture identified in the 5th metatarsal.

notes.content: Patient reports twisting ankle during sports activity.

notes.title: Physical Examination
notes.content: Swelling and tenderness noted over the lateral aspect of the left foot.

findings: Gallstones present within the gallbladder. No signs of acute cholecystitis.

notes.title: Clinical History
notes.content: Patient has a history of right upper quadrant pain after fatty meals.

notes.title: Dietary Habits
notes.content: Patient reports frequent consumption of high-fat foods.

findings: Disc protrusion at L4-L5 causing mild central canal stenosis.

notes.title: Symptoms
notes.content: Patient reports lower back pain radiating down the left leg.

notes.content: Previous attempts at physical therapy provided temporary relief.

findings: Increased metabolic activity in the right axillary lymph node, concerning for malignancy.

notes.content: Follow-up scan for previously diagnosed breast cancer.

notes.content: Patient underwent chemotherapy and radiation therapy 6 months prior.
